data.text: Behold my servant, whom I uphold;
He shall not cry, nor lift up,
A bruised reed shall he not break,
He shall not fail nor be discouraged,
Thus saith God the Lord,
I the Lord have called thee in righteousness,
To open the blind eyes,
I am the Lord: that is my name:
Behold, the former things are come to pass,
Sing unto the Lord a new song,
Let the wilderness and the cities thereof lift up their voice,
Let them give glory unto the Lord,
The Lord shall go forth as a mighty man,
I have long time holden my peace;
I will make waste mountains and hills,
And I will bring the blind by a way that they knew not;
They shall be turned back, they shall be greatly ashamed, that trust in graven images,
Hear, ye deaf;
Who is blind, but my servant?
Seeing many things, but thou observest not;
The Lord is well pleased for his righteousnessâ€™ sake;
But this is a people robbed and spoiled;
Who among you will give ear to this?
Who gave Jacob for a spoil, and Israel to the robbers?
Therefore he hath poured upon him the fury of his anger, and the strength of battle:
